intro: Scaphosepalum martineae, commonly known as the Martineae orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a unique labellum that enhances its ornamental appeal.
